title: Presentation: Saline and Sodic Soils: Understanding Differences and Management Solutions

tasks.task: Observing and recognizing salt issues in fields.
subtasks: Noticing areas where crops struggle (e.g., limited water movement, poor germination).

tasks.task: Understanding soil composition and testing methods.
subtasks: Learning about cation exchange capacity and sodium absorption ratio (SAR).
Conducting soil tests to measure electrical conductivity (EC) and saturated paste extracts.
Collecting soil samples from various depths (e.g., six feet down) to assess salt content.
Applying calcium-rich amendments (e.g., gypsum, calcium chloride) to improve soil structure.
Using sulfur-based amendments (e.g., elemental sulfur) to lower soil pH and reduce sodium levels.

tasks.task: Implementing cover crops and perennial practices.
subtasks: Planting cover crops and perennial plants to improve soil structure and water retention.
Evaluating the depth and necessity of tiling to manage subsoil salts and protect tile drains from sodium deposits.
Adjusting irrigation practices to prevent the upward movement of salts through capillary action.
Regularly testing soil samples for EC, SAR, and other relevant parameters to monitor progress and adjust management practices.
